private_information: Scenario A - Proposed plan (to be validated):
planner_a.goal: Analyze Scenario A and prepare consistent initial facts and goal facts; validate and, if needed, correct the proposed plan to achieve all goal facts.

planner_b.goal: Analyze Scenario B and prepare consistent initial facts and goal facts; propose a feasible plan to achieve the goal facts or explain why not possible.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete and consistent PDDL domain encoding the six actions and a solvable PDDL problem instance for each scenario, compatible with the FastDownwards solver.

init.notes: This environment models object relationships with unary predicates (cats, hand, sneeze, spring, stupendous, texture) and binary predicates (collect, vase, next).

public_information: Available actions and signatures: paltry object_0 object_1 object_2; sip object_0 object_1 object_2; clip object_0 object_1 object_2; wretched object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3; memory object_0 object_1 object_2; tightfisted object_0 object_1 object_2.
Paltry preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2.
Paltry effects add: next object_0 object_2.
Paltry effects delete: vase object_0 object_1.
Sip preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2.
Sip effects add: vase object_0 object_1.
Sip effects delete: next object_0 object_2.
Clip preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2.
Clip effects add: vase object_0 object_1.
Clip effects delete: next object_0 object_2.
Wretched preconditions: sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3.
Wretched effects add: next object_0 object_2.
Wretched effects delete: next object_0 object_1.
Memory preconditions: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1.
Memory effects add: next object_0 object_2.
Memory effects delete: next object_0 object_1.
Tightfisted preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1.
Tightfisted effects add: next object_0 object_2.
Tightfisted effects delete: vase object_0 object_1.
All names and predicates must be preserved exactly for PDDL compilation.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a careful planning analyst. Your job is to extract accurate structured knowledge from the environment description and your private information; do not produce PDDL and do not assume facts not stated.
analysis.prompt: Your name is planner_a. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->planner_a->private_information}. Your objective: {agents->planner_a->goal}. Tasks: 1) List the relevant objects. 2) List true initial facts. 3) List the goal facts. 4) Validate the proposed plan step by step against action preconditions and effects, noting any violations or missing links. 5) If issues exist, propose minimal corrections or an alternative plan that satisfies the goal facts strictly from the available actions and facts. Return a concise analysis.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a careful planning analyst. Your job is to extract accurate structured knowledge from the environment description and your private information; do not produce PDDL and do not assume facts not stated.
analysis.prompt: Your name is planner_b. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->planner_b->private_information}. Your objective: {agents->planner_b->goal}. Tasks: 1) List the relevant objects. 2) List true initial facts. 3) List the goal facts. 4) Propose a feasible plan using the available actions and justify that each step meets its preconditions and produces required effects. 5) If no plan is possible, explain precisely which missing preconditions or conflicts prevent achieving the goal and suggest what additional facts would be required. Return a concise analysis.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL for classical planning and in building instances for the FastDownwards solver. Always output a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem enclosed within <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags. The domain must encode exactly the six actions (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) with the predicates and effects specified in the public information. Use only predicates listed by the environment, use object names exactly as provided (object_0 ... object_13), and ensure syntax compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the analysts' outputs to produce a single correct PDDL domain for the task and at least one PDDL problem for Scenario A; if feasible, include a second problem instance for Scenario B after the first problem as commented guidance or as a separate problem block. Use the initial facts and goal facts as given, resolve inconsistencies conservatively, and do not invent new predicates or constants. Ensure the resulting PDDL is syntactically valid and solvable by FastDownwards.
